website_summaries.verdict: The Brother HL-2170W laser printer can be the perfect money saving sidekick to your existing inkjet, but don't expect it to handle even the most minor graphic jobs.
pros: wireless option is convenient after initial setup, short initial lag time

customer_reviews.title: sturdy little workhorse after 8 years, and still kicking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in 2010. Been using heavily for 8 years now, and it still works fantastic. Hasn't ever needed a repair despite heavy use. As a grad student now, I especially print A LOT. I don't use the wireless feature, although I did use bluetooth once in a pinch. I replace the toner maybe twice a year, with low lost recycled toner. Almost always print double-sided. Tip: Avoid loading the paper tray too full; its best at 3/4 or less, or else it may grab multiple pages at once when trying to print to one sheet.
customer_reviews.author: amazeusmozart

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but obsoleted by Brother and Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer along with two other Brother printers for years and years. This one worked fine as a network printer, but now under Win 10 it has to be reset with almost every use. I will keep it until this toner cartridge runs out. Then donate to GoodWill Industries. But, it you have any pre Win 10 operating system including Linux it will work fine without constant attention. Brother still provides excellent online support.
customer_reviews.author: czs712

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: This little printer is a workhorse. It just keeps printing away and does a great job. We also have an HP Photosmart All-in-One which makes great color copies, but we do not use it for any of the black and white copying. HP was extremely smart because their ink ends up costing more than the printer. HP could give the printers away free and HP would still make a fortune off their ink. The negative about the Brother HL-2170W is it is almost impossible to hook up wireless so I have it wired direct to my computer. My HP is also wireless and it hooks very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Big Foot

customer_reviews.title: Once you survive the setup, this printer is great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer on sale from Amazon.com and wasn't disappointed. Although the instructions recommended setup via a USB cable but said that the printer can be setup wirelessly, I tried the latter route and couldn't get the thing to work. I learned my lesson and setup the printer with a USB cable. Everything went off without a hitch. This printer has performed flawlessly for me. It never loses its wireless connection to my home network and it prints pages quickly and quietly. If you need a B&W laser printer and want to keep it separate from your computer, you can't go wrong with this little gem of a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Jotz

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Kind of hard to set up to entire home network- some computers it was very easy, others refused to recognize an Ad-Hoc network. Once you change the printer's setting to connect to your wireless network, you can have computers that are connected via wireless and hardwired LAN connect and print to this printer. Having one "efficient" printer rather than $50 Lexmark or hp w/ ink cartridges that are very expensive and inefficient connected to each machine is a big bonus. Love to be able to have the laptop connected in the kitchen and print to the printer with no cords or wires. Would buy again. Great quality, and once you figure out the setup, works how it should.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Brother 2170W a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Brother 2170W from Tiger Direct through Amazon. I purchased it because I was tired of paying $50+ for inkjet ink every couple of months. I am very pleased with the printer. It was easy to setup as a wireless printer (I connected it to my router via cable for setup as recommended). I can print from any computer in my house and it prints very fast. The only drawback is that when they start printing, laser printers are power hungry and the printer caused my computer to shutdown when it saw the power dip. Once I connected the printer to a different outlet, everything was fine. I would highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: jbcmass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer at an Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful laser printer (the second Brother Laser I've owned--both were solid performers). Images are crisp and clean and Customer Support can help with any installation issues you might encounter (as I did) with Vista. Once you're properly set up, it's a snap to add all your networked computers so that EVERYONE on the network can easily print, WIRELESSLY, to this great little workhorse. I love the fact that it's a standalone printer (i.e. you print directly to it, not through another computer connected to the printer--duh, it's wireless!). The paper tray holds a generous amount of paper. I love this printer!
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid printing solution
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd Brother laser printer (including one multi-function printer/fax) and all three have been rock solid. Adding this printer to our wireless network was very easy and all of our computers (all Apples running OS X, 10.5) found it and configured the drivers automatically. The printer is fast and with very good output quality. Replacement toner is relatively inexpensive and we get a lot of copies out of these printers between toner or drum replacements. I have recommended Brother's printers to others and without exception have heard back only positive comments.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Great b&w printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this printer. It worked great for many years!! It printed quickly and the toner cartridges lasted forever. It was my first wireless printer so it spoiled me. One day it just stopped accepting wireless signal after several years of daily use. It still worked with a wired connection but I replaced it with a different brother laser printer because I needed the wireless features.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pool

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer & FLAWLESS Wireless Setup
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Brother laser printer, and they get better every time. This one lets you print from 3 types of connnections - USB, wired Ethernet, and wireless Ethernet. Also, the paper seems to curl less than the last printer. The USB setup was very easy. I connected the first computer directly with USB, and then the second computer via wireless. You can have both connected at the same time. The wireless setup was flawless (recommend you use the wired connection during setup, then remove the wire as explained in the manual). You have to know your wireless router password, but other than that it's pretty straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: T. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Have owned this for twelve years now. It still works great.
customer_reviews.text: Twelve years and four moves later, this thing still works great. What more is there to say? It's a printer. It prints things. It has always done this. Hasn't required much maintenance at all, replacing drum/toner is probably foolproof, doesn't jam frequently, print quality's good, wifi works well so you can stick it in a closet or an out-of-the-way corner..
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ames

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Setup Issues for this printer !!!
customer_reviews.text: Most people will have a terrible time setting up this printer. This is because the printer ships with its network card turned off. Neither the printed setup manual nor the manual you download from brother's website mentions this. So most people will follow the setup instructions and hit a brick wall when it comes to connecting the printer to the router for the wireless setup. Bottom line is, when you turn on the network card (by a series of complicated maneouvers check the FAQ on the Brother website) it works fine. The printer is very flimsily built. But so far it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best printer ever!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this printer. It's been about a year now and I'm still on the same toner. You have to put a little piece of tape over the sensors or it will say low ink. But then once the tape is on it goes forever again. I will never ever buy an ink jet again. I love being able to print out all kinda of stupid stuff without worrying about having to buy 35 dollar ink. This thing would be great for a small office or home use. I print out tons of coloring picture for my daughter. Iv'e went through at least 3 packs of printer paper and am still on the same toner that it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Just an awesome troublefree printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I bought it in 2010 from Amazon and it's almost 2019 and it's still working just fine. I have used it wired and wireless with no trouble whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer on sale for a $110. It was for my college apartment and 5 of us shared the thing through a wireless router. Last I checked, it was still working well (I sold it to my roommates after moving out for half price). The ink cartridge is about double the size compared to HP Laserjets. I didn't have much trouble making it a wireless setup. I put the connection through a Linksys WRT54GL router. The driver software worked both on Windows and Mac. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with the product, though I wouldn't pay the current list price of $230 for it.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: very reliable
customer_reviews.text: -- have had three of these printers running in small office & home offices for over a year now, all run perfect. -- have had one paper crinkle up & jam out of 200 pages per day being printed 5-days a week. -- reasonable toner consumption, these do not burn nearly as much ink as I thought they might. I only use these toner replacements: -- wireless & wired networking is pretty simple to setup ... basically "set & forget" -- I really dig this printer ... it's a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Clean

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Have had it in service for about three weeks and so far we love it. For the money (I paid $89 with free ship for new unit)I can't see how one could beat it. I haven't seen any curl in my pages as suggested by one reviewer... However, setting up the wireless is another issue. I've been unable to get it to work, but it might just be my ineptness with such things. A wired network setup was a breeze and that's how we're using it in my house. Great printer...recommend it highly...if the price is right. JRM - Columbus Ohio
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: I am a heavy computer user and this and my Epson Artisan 800 color inkjet printer/scanner/fax are the two best hard-copy periphe
customer_reviews.text: I have had this laser printer for a few years now and have moved four times. It is as solid as the day I bought it, faithfully printing out top-notch laser copies. For the price I do not think you can beat it., I am a heavy computer user and this and my Epson Artisan 800 color inkjet printer/scanner/fax are the two best hard-copy peripherals I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.author: newzguy1

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer but probably not great for a novice if you want to use the wireless feature
customer_reviews.text: This printer works like a charm from Windows and Mac OS X. After initial setup, the windows installer for the drivers was great. It discovered the printer automatically and installed it. No work required for the individual user. Setting up the printer is not the most straight forward thing in the world. I was able to set it up without issue by connecting it via ethernet then connecting to it that way to setup the wireless, to avoid the default adhoc network problem others have spoke about. If you don't do that first, it's going to be a pain in the neck.
customer_reviews.author: James Ferrier

customer_reviews.title: Set up not for novice
customer_reviews.text: I picked this Brother laser printer because it was recommended as Editor's Choice in PC magazine. I'm a novice where installing PC hardware is concerned and had problems hooking up wireless. I ended up asking my friend who is an expert in network. I expected him to hook the printer up with no problem but even he had some problems trying to make the computer communicate with the printer. I'm very happy with the printer once it was properly set up but ease of set up wireless? Not for users who are not familiar with configuring wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kim

customer_reviews.title: EASY SET-UP BUT EXPENSIVE TO PRINT
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for less than 6 weeks and used it relatively little when it stopped running in the middle of a job because the ink cartridge already needed to be replaced. Luckily I had read a feedback comment on this site warning of this problem and was able to tape the small window on one side of the cartridge as instructed and resume my printing job. It's disgraceful that printer cartridges cost so much, but even more so that this particular printer--which is admittedly cheap to buy upfront--was designed so blatantly to rip off consumers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very capable printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use item. It is wireless but I could not get it to communicate with the router so I use the cord. That is fine as the printer and the laptop are generally in the same room. It is easy to replace the printer cartridge and it works well with the no name replacement toner cartridges. Good price and good for medium home/school use.
customer_reviews.author: LMK

customer_reviews.title: Love it! If only wireless were a little more reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little printer and excellent value for money. Make sure you do the little toner trick several people have mentioned. I just finished my second toner cartrige at page count 5,200, i.e. >2,500 pages per cartridge. Unbeatable! I run this printer only on wireless with several PCs + iPad + Mac using it. Pros: pretty reliable (other than the wireless thing, see below--but it doesn't happen that often); also, great value for money and good print quality Cons: wireless connectivity sometimes drops, and you need to reboot PC and printer for it to work again (also, the intial wireless setup was a little tricky); one-sided printing only (I only realized this after I bought it)
customer_reviews.author: Katja R. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laser printer after growing tired of the endless inkjet replacement cartridge costs. Its a fantastic unit so far I really like it. One tip for wireless setup: download the wireless setup guide from Brother for this unit - its a separate PDF document and its incredibly simple step by step. I am using this printer with two PC laptops (one vista and one XP) and two Macs all wireless no problem. Trust me download the that guide - the directions that come with this printer skip some of the key steps for wireless setup.
customer_reviews.author: rhodyfresh

customer_reviews.title: Reliable printer after 2 years.  Toner lasts long time!
customer_reviews.text: No problems after 2 years on my home network where Macs and PCs live together. Get a TN-360 high yield toner cartridge. When it complains the toner is low, stick a small piece of black tape over the dime-sized side window on the toner cartridge. It will last another 6 months or so. When it starts printing spotty, get a new one. Printing costs are *so* much lower than ink jet. I can live without the color. Goodbye "capitalist bastard" inkjet manufacturers; you know who you are. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ed Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer this week. After reading many of the helpful hints other reviewers gave, I used the "cable" set-up, even though I have a one-touch Linksys router. It worked great. I then loaded the printer drivers to my laptop, and I am printing from wherever I am. Good print quality and not much more of a footprint than my old HP Inkjet. It is a bit loud, but that's many because it is right next to my PC for now. I am planning on moving it. Got a great deal through Amazon ($40 instant rebate, plus $10 off through Bill Me Later) and ended up paying $90 for this great printer. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PBenton

customer_reviews.title: super de duper
customer_reviews.text: We refuse to buy another HP because they will not support our trusty little HP1012 in the new Windows 7 operating environment. So we bought the Brother. My wife wants to wirelessly connect all the computers with this new printer but it's not so simple for the faint of heart (and computer illiterate). After one month, and numerous instruction manual reads, nobody's had the guts to try. The printer is noisier than our old HP but much faster. It just spits out pages like no tomorrow. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy wired setup - Pricey Consumables
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. It was very easy to set up as a wired network printer. Plugged it it - the printer assigned itself an IP address and I just ran the setup (after turning off my firewall). Took 5 minutes tops. The consumables are a bit pricey. The drum is a separate consumable which must be replaced every 12,000 pages. Adding the toner and the drum costs together makes this one of the more expensive laser printers to operate. However, it's reasonable if your printing volume is small. I have not attempted to use the wireless setup.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This printer arrived the day after I ordered it, even though I opted for free shipping, so things were off to a good start. Setup was a minor annoyance because I had to disable the network firewall before the software would find the printer. Once the printer was installed on the network, adding the print driver to my other computer was a breeze. And the print quality, speed and price are wonderful. I suffered with a 5-to-10-year old inkjet that cost me a bundle for ink that didn't seem to last. Now, I'm delighted to have a high-quality, wireless laser printer at home for a good price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bowe

customer_reviews.title: Great all around printer, easy setup for wireless
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this printer after reading a number of reviews that described hours devoted to setting up this wireless component. However, I was very excited to be printing from 2 separate Windows Vista computers wireless-ly less than 8 minutes out of the box. Following the instructions proved to be the way to go! (Imagine that!) The initial print quality is great and the speed is impressive. The printer is a bit smaller than I imagined, but I am very satisfied with this purchase. Overall, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Farver

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding.  No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this as I needed something faster than my HP dot matrix. I thought the direct connect to the network would be useful instead of attaching it to another PC. Worked right out of the box connected directly to a LAN cable in my house. Ran the installation wizard with no problems. I have not tried the wifi connection as the coverage in the room I have it is weak. I am totally impressed with the speed and quality of this printer and I've already printed hundreds of pages with the starter cartridge. Highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Don V

customer_reviews.title: excellent printer, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a breeze to set up for wireless access. There are lots of security/encryption options and there's a very good range on the built in wireless device. The client software is fairly small and easy to install. Never had a problem with print quality. One very neat angle on this printer is that it seems built in troubleshooting tools and methods were at the forefront of its design. It's very easy to reset the config or find other issues by pressing a single button. Always remember to get the latest firmware before you walk away.
customer_reviews.author: DALTON JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: A little jem
customer_reviews.text: Worked well out of the box. I can print via wired or wireless. The built-in network card connects directly to my switch, saving a USB port on my computer, as well as allowing others to print without slowing my machine down. Built in wireless network card is very nice, also. The toner cartridge looks a bit small, and the quantity of pages has yet to be determined. Print quality is good. Set up was easy with the provided CD. A Windows 7 CD is also included. Overall, this small laser printer is a lot of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great and was very easy to set up to work wirelessly. It took about 15 mins to get all three laptops in the house up and printing on the wireless network. I've printed a few photos and I am extremely pleased with the quality. Here are the reasons I chose this printer 1)everyone in the house now accesses a wireless network, 2) although we have 3 printer/copier/scanners none of them worked with the 3 laptops we now use 3) after reviewing our printing needs we couldn't remember the last time we actually needed to print in color 4) the price was right. This printer fits all of our needs and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice compact printer only standing about 7 inches high. I recommend setting up the wired connection first. After that's done, the wireless setup is a breeze. It prints quickly and looks great. The only downside is that you have to manually feed the paper if you want it double-sided, and it can be kind of tricky to get the printer to pull from the manual feed. Also, there is no manual feed tray, so you have to hold the page in the slot until it pulls it in. Other than that, this is a great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: M. Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Mac user loves this printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a Snow Leopard 10.6.2 laptop and a Tiger laptop 5.4.8. Both laptops work great with this printer. Wireless setup was a bit tricky at first. Setup the wired network connection first, by setting up the printer with your DSL box. Then forget the user guide, and user your own Mac OS knowledge to set this printer up for wireless connectivity. I can now sit in the front yard and print to this printer sitting in my closet. Amazing! I've also setup the printer via USB to use as well. Amazing printer for the price. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Head

customer_reviews.title: Works well, once you get it installed.
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for me for Valentine's day. I had wanted a laser printer and he found this one on Amazon at a great price. We had a difficult time installing it and making it work. We read the instructions, tried every way we could to get it installed. At this present point in time we are able to use it via the usb cable. We still have not been able to get it to work wirelessly with our wireless modem on our network. I am happy with the quality of the item, it does work just fine and the print quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy this instead of the cheaper laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I just finished installing and setting up this printer for wireless access on my iMac. Setup with the unit temporarily plugged into my router with a network cable was very simple. Now, when the unit is powered on it connects automatically to my WPA encrypted network. Cool! It prints very fast and the images are very dark and crisp. I expect this printer to be more reliable and produce better b/w prints than my crappy Kodak Easyshare 5100 inkjet. Could not be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: cjb

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Wireless setup was a bit more complex than just plugging it in... but we followed the procedure in the directions and it worked beautifully the first time (connect the printer via ethernet cable first, complete the setup with the included CD, then unplug from ethernet and use via WiFi). I have an older Brother printer which I have been very happy with. This one is not as tall (smaller total volume), has WiFi connectivity, and is otherwise very similar. Couldn't be happier with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer has printed over 1500 sheets with starter cartridge
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this printer over the past year. I have probably printed in excess of 1500 copies on the included starter cartridge ( with the help of placing a piece of opaque tape over the toner sensor). It is a bit noisy but not too much. Wireless setup can be tricky, it's much easier to connect it by usb first and do the install then use it wirelessly. Overall a very good printer and economical if you do the toner trick thing. I am about to order my first replacement cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Audio Maven

customer_reviews.title: It has worked great..
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been through 3 moves, I bought it in 2009 and it is now 2016. It has worked great...i think its so old they don't service some parts but that means brother has such a quality product. The tech geeks in my family would buy HP, Epson etc and they would always break down after about 3 years. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: book_reader1

customer_reviews.title: fantastic performance, tough to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer: couldn't ask for a better printer for the price. We have wireless internet in our city (so our network setup is not quite normal). Besides the frustrations over getting it setup- we couldn't be happier with the performance of this printer: it is very fast and has great wireless signal and range. I can send a print job from the kitchen and by the time I walk over to the office, it is there waiting for me! Great deal on a great printer! Oh yeah, Linux recognized this printer right away- no driver setup needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcello Sias

customer_reviews.title: wireless setup
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer yesterday, and it took me several hours to setup the wireless network. The major problem I believe is the documentation. I tried to set up the printer from my wired power mac. Apparently it is a quite straightforward process if setting up the wireless from mac book with wireless networking. In a word, if you set it up the wireless using wireless networked macbook or windows laptop (I guess), it is pretty simple. Otherwise, you may run into the painful process I experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Yuhong Wang

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet connection would not stay on...
customer_reviews.text: It was not difficult to set it up. Once it was set up, I had a test print done by pressing a button. It was easy. Then I connected it to my home network by plugging an Ethernet cable into the designated receptacle. The Ethernet ready light came on for a brief moment and went out. I tried to unplug and re-plug many times but nothing helped. Needless to say, it was useless because I could not use it wired or wireless. I returned it to Amazon the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Pine Nut

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a HP laser snob for a long time. In recent years, HP quality has taken a nosedive to the point where I was ready to buy anything but an HP. I picked up this little (it isn't much bigger than a few reams of paper) printer and am very happy with it. It was much easier to setup than the instructions imply, so don't let them bother you. Wireless is flawless with both PCs and Macs (but use wired ethernet for initial setup). Warmup time is brief, pages come out quickly, and quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. mcnalley

customer_reviews.title: Brother Laser Printer HL-2170W
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. It is the first laser printer and also the first NON-HP printer that I have owned. It has performed flawlessly. I decided to use a wired connection rather than wireless. It was easy to set up with all the household computers and works every time. I'm still using the toner that came with the printer and haven't run an actual count of pages printed, but believe me, by now I would have gone through a few HP print cartridges--that was my biggest complaint with the HP printers. I would highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: cmwillms

customer_reviews.title: Durable but wireless set up is pain
customer_reviews.text: For a basic monochrome single-side printer this printer works well and is very durable and drum and toner last for years. Unfortunately, the wireless set up is not plug and play and needs tweaking in Windows Network Setup. Did it once but when moved to a new location just used the Ethernet connection instead.​
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dahlem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the Brother HL-2170W printer. The print quality is good. I purchased the most recent one to replace a 4-year old Brother printer that I needed to adjust the feeder on, but decided to replace with a wireless printer. The only complaints I have are that sometimes the pages printed are a little more "curled" than I'd like. But this is rare. During wireless setup, the configuration is considerably easier if you connect the printer via Ethernet first. Although wireless-only setup is supported, I found it to be cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Printer. I have it hooked to my network router by ethernet and it works great. It does draw a lot of amps when it goes to print the first page. I had to unplug it from my UPS. 9/6/13 Update. Still going strong after 5 years and about 10,000 pages. Not that the toner life can be extended significantly by covering the "sight glass" on the end of the cartridge. This fools the printer into think it has a full cartridge and can extend the life of quality printing up to double.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-2170 Wireless Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: Had read a number of negative reviews concerning difficulty in setting up the wireless network connection, but had NO problems at all. Worked the first time and has performed flawlessly since. It doesn't do all that well with hi-res graphics, but images are acceptable. Works fine for text. Would recommend for SOHO or home use without reservation based on a month's worth of experience. FWIW, the new Brother driver from the website seems to be an improvement over the one on the CD that comes with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mstar

customer_reviews.title: HL-2170w Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I run a home office and it is nice to bring the wireless printer into other rooms. Sometimes I like a change of "scenery" and will work at the kitchen table or living room. It is nice to move the printer into the room and be able to have my print jobs within arms reach and still have the other computers in the house print to it at the same time. Yes, that makes me lazy but it gets the job done. It prints fast and great quality. It is much cheaper than printing to my ink jet too. An excellent value at $99.00
customer_reviews.author: dmanrtfm

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use With Mac OSX Leopard and Snow Leopard
customer_reviews.text: Following the in-box provided directions I had this printer connected and operating wirelessly in 10 minutes. It worked first time on my protected wireless network (Airport) with the Mac I used to set it up and my second Mac needed no set-up whatsoever other than adding the printer in System Preferences. Excellent printer for the price. Compact and light - easy to move around as needed. The toner is expensive but then all are regardless of brand.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Gadget Nut

customer_reviews.title: Mine had power issues and finally sparked out
customer_reviews.text: Quite literally. It was an economical printer while it lasted, which was almost 4 years, but every time I printed from it, my voltage regulators would trip. Not just the one it was hooked up to - the thing would brown out my entire house. Then, today, FLASH BANG - one dead voltage regulator, one dead printer, one scared cat in the office. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRINTER - GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Canon ink jet printer and Im constantly changing the ink tank. This laser toner will last much, much longer- especially since I set it to Toner Saver mode. I used the direct wire hookup to set the printer up and it worked on my main computer like a charm. I was then able to add the drivers to my son's computer upstairs as well as to my laptop. Everything works wireless without any problem. I love the convenience , speed and toner value of this printer. Thanks Brother and thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: E. Cris

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years and Still Running Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer 2 years ago when I entered grad school. I print almost daily and frequently in large volumes. I wish I had known about the convenience of personal laser printers when I was an undergrad! I haven't run into any problems in the two years that I've been using it. It was extremely easy to setup, it prints quickly and at a very good quality. The pages do tend to curl a little bit, which can be annoying, but isn't a major detractor. Absolutely worth every penny. A great gift for a college student! They may think it's boring, but they have no idea how much easier it makes life!
customer_reviews.author: Tony White

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. I have four computers on a network. Hooked up the printer to my wireless router via a wired ethernet port and was done . Had it up and running in a few minutes with Windows Vista. The Vista drivers are much better than HP's.If your printer is close to your router there is no need to use the wireless feature on the printer. Printer is fast and has excellent print quality. Nice large paper tray.Prefer it to the HP I used to own.
customer_reviews.author: winet

customer_reviews.title: Never a problem with a "Brother"
customer_reviews.text: I've owned them all; both in my businesses and at home. I can say unequivocally that the "simple" Brother laser printers, copiers and faxes are the only ones I've never had any trouble. In fact, I had my first Brother laser printer so long that it would no longer interface with the new operating system that came out with my new computer. For a truly simple laser printer at $90, you can't go wrong. It just works, and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Just received this printer and it's great! It was a little bit tricky to set up on one computer and 2 laptops, but definitely doable. It prints fast and clean and the wireless connection is great. I can have this printer anywhere in the house and it prints from any of my computers. Couldn't ask for anything more! Perfect for all the text printing one has to do without wasting ink on their photo printers. I would recommend this printer to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: LDS

customer_reviews.title: Could'nt be easier
customer_reviews.text: When I received my 2170w printer from Amazon, in perfect condition by the way, I set it up wirelessly on two computers (emachines desktop and compaq laptop with netgear router) in about 20 minutes using the supplied CD. The process was effortless and worked the first time. The only glitch was I could'nt remember the authentication type of my router...I never wrote it down when setting up my router...I took a guess and it worked fine. It prints fast and nicely. What a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Merk

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer
customer_reviews.text: Being able to have this printer away from both the computer AND the wireless access point is really convenient, and it works very well. The print quality is good, and the 23 ppm print rate is fast. I'm happy with it. Setup under Windows XP is kind of a pain, and involved installing, deleting, and re-installing the drivers in two different ways in order to make the thing work. Under Vista and MacOS X was a breeze, and took less than a minute to get a test page successfully printed through each. I'd recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Scroop

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new from Amazon for an unbelievable $106, shipping included (I see it is no longer listed at that price). Nothing can beat that value. Setup was trivial (I'm using USB; wireless wasn't of much interest to me). Print quality is very good. Print speed is also pretty good. I remember when a similarly specified printer would have sold for $1000, so I just can't believe what the current price/performance point is these days. I'd recommend this printer in a hearbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hill

customer_reviews.title: Solid printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: The printer was fairly easy to install, but not trivial. My 13 year old son took about 40 minutes to get it up and running with a few mis-starts. Once we figured it out, the install went fine. Printer is fast, warms up quickly, and has great print quality. The wireless feature is really cool, print from any computer in the house with just a CD ROM install - no windows networking hassles. We have on computer that's not working with the printer, it's a Vista that's having other problems. Haven't gotten around to trying to fix that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great printer with out great linux drivers
customer_reviews.text: I connected this to a wired network - I have not tried the wireless connections. It was very easy. Printer works well. One problem (otherwise I would have given it five stars) - there are no really good linux drivers (some so-so ones but no great ones - get on it Brothers!) 1 July 2010 - I am using a later version of Ubuntu - Ubuntu 10.04 now. The printer works fine with this version (so I changed my rating to 5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Marc Mehlman

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: I relied on the other reviews from Amazon customers to pick this printer. I am almost completely satisfied with the product. Nice crisp B & W print. Speed is just fine for my needs. Set up was easy. The only thing I have to figure out is how to set it up for wireless printing. That is a bit confusing from the directions and all. It is not "plug and play per se." I am sure I will get it going that way, but for now the USB cable is working well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bargerstock

customer_reviews.title: Great laser printer for a fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer 3 months ago and it has performed flawlessly. Setup was extremely easy. I wanted a wireless printer and the setup under Vista couldn't have been easier. It is important to follow the setup instructions EXACTLY or the wireless connection will fail. The printer has an extremely small footprint and with it being wireless, it gets tucked under my desk out of the way. I couldn't be happier with this printer!
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install on a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Nice little printer. Read previous reviews before I purchased the product. Wanted something of laser jet quality, inexpensive on ink and wireless. So far this little printer does what it's stated it would do. Some reviewers seemed like they had a hard time with wireless connectivity. I followed the instructions carefully and had the printer working in 20 minutes on Macbook and IMac.
customer_reviews.author: D. Louie

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless network printer.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, the output is very good and the sheets don't curl too much. Setup was easy (especially if you read the manuls first) Just plug it into the router as recommended for the initial setup. Then you can use the web page to administer it. It looks like it was fairly well made and has great features (holds half a reem). I'll update after a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: James Peterson

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY BUY!
customer_reviews.text: very good value for money. minimal cost per page. wireless feature very easy just follow the step by stem instructions in the software (that you can also download online). Make sure you cover the sensor in the toner which indicates the cartridge life and it will last you A LOT longer!! Google that to find out out exactly how to do it. It makes a huge difference and saves you a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: DANI

customer_reviews.title: Get the latest BIOS and use the CD to set it up
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself pretty good with computers but couldn't get the printer's wireless feature to configure. I tried using the web-based administrative panel, but no matter what, the wireless settings wouldn't negotiate or stick. However, once I grabbed the latest BIOS from the Brother website, I found that if you use the CD, everything associates properly. Maybe I'm not as smart as I think I am!
customer_reviews.author: Michael N.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave a review for a product, but I have to this time. I had a Brother 2070 printer and loved it, but Amazon is not selling it any more, so I thought I would buy a 2170 and I expected it to be better than 2070 or at least have the same quality. However, 2170 is extremely disappointing. The toner ran out quickly. The printing often went wrong and came out with some nonsense text on the paper. Paper jam is not unusual. I just wish I had returned the printer earlier. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Good home office printer
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a month now, the startup time to print one page is great compared to those other ink jet style printers. If you don't care about printing color photos and just do monochrome stuff, I would recommend this product. We have it hooked up to the Wireless Network and it is great since we don't have a dedicated home office desk, we have two laptops that we print from. Don't waste your money on that other brand, Hotel Papa.
customer_reviews.author: Skinny

customer_reviews.title: Efficient little printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice little black and white laser printer. Good, clear quality and is easy on toner! Still have it. It is not the type of printer I would use for a large printing project but works great for someone who prints occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Quick and wireless - works well in our home.
customer_reviews.text: The Brother HL-2170w was easy to set up and because it is wireless, it can live anywhere in the house. Currently, I have three laptops set up to print to the HL-2170w; two HP laptops running Vista and an Asus EEE netbook which has Ubuntu 8.04 installed. Everything works well. I am pleased with this light weight laser printer that prints several pages a minute. It does not have color, but the consumables are available at a reasonable price (I believe a $50 cartridge will print 3000 pages).
customer_reviews.author: OneManBand

customer_reviews.title: Wired or Wireless Connection does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: It is a fine printer. Although it is kind of noisy during warming-up, it is generally quiet when idle. Print quality is fine. Cable- and wireless-connection simply does not work for this printer. I tried eight times in total to set up the network connection through Ethernet cable as well as the wireless router. I followed the instructions precisely, going through all steps including factory-reset after each failed attempt. Just could not make it work! I have given up for now, and am using it through usb cable. Overall, I'd rather recommend its junior instead, model HL-2170, that seems identical to HL-2170w just w/o the wired/wireless capability (which is NOT functioning at all anyway.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about this printer when I read a few of the reviews (wireless connection and print quality). After setting up and connecting to my wireless network, I'm thrilled with the printer and quality of output. A larger paper tray that takes a full ream of 500 sheets would be great, but we are very happy with this compliment to our Multi-Function inkjet(also a Brother).
customer_reviews.author: B. Gilles

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to setup on Mac OS 10.5
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer - it's compact, very fast and has great quality print outs. The duplex feature is relatively easy to use. However, if you are planning to use this with a Mac running OS 10.5.x, you should be aware that setup can be difficult which is why I only give it 4 stars. I followed all the instructions in the included setup manual and the printer would not work - I got a "printer offline" error every time I tried. I had to modify the printer settings in the Mac CUPS. You have to do this every time you update the OS!
customer_reviews.author: S. Tasoni

customer_reviews.title: Small Form Factor for a Laser Printer, Works As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small laser printer, which is still pretty big, but for a laser printer with built in wifi, its pretty small. I have it set up for wireless printing with it generating its own wifi signal and I switching to "Printer" whenever I want to print. It works for a small dorm room where I have 1 desk for working on the computer, and 1 desk for printing/my TV.
customer_reviews.author: DJMoody

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer...but came with a faulty print cartridge
customer_reviews.text: The Brother 2170W is a very fast printer. Unfortunately, the cartridge that it came with would print small lines on the left side of each page. It is not a big deal because I use it for personal use, not business, so the lines don't detract from my tasks. I bought a new cartridge and the lines disappeared. I'd recommend this printer to anyone that wants a REALLY fast printer for a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Brady

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the cat's meow. It hasn't jammed once since we've had it (9 months now). We haven't even had to change the original toner yet, either. The wi-fi isn't too difficult to set up if you follow the instructions. We've never lost connectivity with it. It prints very fast and you can stick it anywhere with the wi-fi. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Fariss

customer_reviews.title: Works great after tech. help from Brother
customer_reviews.text: The CD that came with it for installation for some reason would not run. I called Brother and instead of making me wait for a new CD, one of there very patient knowledgeable techs stayed on the phone with me, walked me through the whole installation and waited to be sure it worked properly.It wakes up and prints very fast. I am very happy with it and Brothers service.
customer_reviews.author: Gull

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: 6 years later this printer has been great. no issues at all. been using wireless function forever. toner cartridge trick is awesome covering the plastic side of toner with tape to prolong toner. still using to this day.
customer_reviews.author: stuff

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Love the wireless printing. Initial setup was easy, but had to restamp the drive on my laptop and for some reason setting it up again was a little more difficult but still not that bad. Overall very satisfied. Warms up really fast even after weeks of being in standby mode. Excellent alternative when color printing is not needed. I decided to supplement with an all in one color for those rare occasions that I HAVE to print in color. Great print quality. Very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a laser printer for a while now, and when my color ink jet died, I decided the time was perfect. Fortunately, we have a super duper color printer in the house for photographs. Therefore, the laser print is perfect for all black and white printing. I can now print all of the sheet music and other print jobs without worrying about replacing cartridges all the time. It is "just what I wanted", and I couldn't be more pleased. Installation with my Mac was seamless.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless b/w laser printer
customer_reviews.text: The setup was slightly more complicated than I think is necessary but this is otherwise an awesome printer! It prints very fast and begins printing from stand-by very quickly as well. The printed pages are crisp and readable. I am making use of it's built-in wireless networking. The paper tray is also quite large. All around, this printer is awesome and the price is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my grandmother. It gets the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandmother. It gets the job done and it's simple enough she can always use it and know it will work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless interface DOES work!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third purchase I've made of this model, one for home, and two for work. They're reliable, and once the toner cartridge trick is known, cost effective, and the quality of the print is excellent. The wireless connectivity has been an issue, and I've always used the ethernet option because I couldn't get the other to work. This time, however, I followed the directions to the letter, and it worked. I haven't gone back and reconfigured the other two, but I will. This printer works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Computer teacher

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: Setup is easy if you take your time and follow the instructions carefully. Be sure and use the suggested USB install, even though wi-fi is available. Operation is fine; haven't printed enough to evaluate cost/copy however. Only complaint is that the paper drawer is difficult to open and somewhat flimsy, so I'm very careful not to break it.
customer_reviews.author: middnite

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great wireless connectivity. solid prints. found knock off brand ink and it runs it flawlessly. would easily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the fastest printer, however for home use it's more than adequate. It's very cheap to operate and I've yet to experience a single problem out of it with around 20000 pages printed over a 2 year time period.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: The oppposite of rock solid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer based on the positive reviews here. I was looking for a replacement for a 7 year old samsung 1710, which was a tank that required only three things to work - paper, power, and toner. The Brother requires 4 things. Paper, power, toner, and constant oversight. It's not something I can leave my family to use. If it's not a paper jam, it some other random error that requires a power cycle to clear. Everything else is great about it. Fast, good print quality, cheap refillable toner. Refillable toner is key for me. Next time I will listen to my experiences, rather than the reviews here, and buy another samsung laser.
customer_reviews.author: Jacy Legault

customer_reviews.title: Not Label Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this printer to replace an OKI B4100 that needed a new drum. This printer was cheaper than a replacement drum for the old printer so we got the Brother. If all you print is normal weight paper then this unit is fine. Decent quality and speed for an inexpensive unit. The problem came when we attempted to print mailing labels. It jammed repeatedly. Sucking in 2-3 sheets of labels at a time, getting stuck, labels jamming everywhere. It was a big mess and we never did get all the label gunk out. We came to the conclusion that this printer simply cannot print labels, period. So we have to return it because we need to print labels often.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent B&W Printer, Difficult wifi setup.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this printer and had a pretty difficult time installing it for a wifi networked connection, but once that was done it's been excellent. Quick printing, no paper jam problems, and good quality prints. It IS a black and white laser printer, so as long as you don't try to print pictures with it and stick to documents you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: I use as a second printer so not to use up my expensive ink
customer_reviews.text: Very basic printer and works great. I have two printers, a nice color inkjet and this one prints only black of course but I like the fact that with toner cartridges I can print a ton of stuff without worrying about using up my precious ink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-2170W Printer
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, this printer is terrific. I am replacing another Laser Printer that cost 3 times as much and this printer does everything the other printer did. I am very pleased with the purchase! 'Bought this printer in 2008 and here it is 2013 and I am still using this printer. Should speak well for its durability and versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Although the printer is noisy (as noted by others), it gets the job done. The manual feed mechanism is a little cheap, but it works. Make sure to open the back of the printer before a manual feed job, as it crinkles envelopes and label sheets if allowed to finish through the roller. Still, all in all, a good deal for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great printer at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for a small construction office. It was easy to set up, and prints relatively quickly. The only complaint I would have is that it does not come with a usb plug, so unless you plan on using it as a wireless printer you must buy and additional piece to hardwire your printer in order for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great home B/W  high speed  printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great no frills B/W laser printer!! Biggest job I did with it was about 80 pages. Really spits the pages out. Never had to clear a jam and replacement cartridges can be found for $10.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Caution for Apple Users
customer_reviews.text: The printer works fine. However, if you have an apple, and expect to use the wireless feature, I can tell you that it will be a huge pain. It is not an easy set-up, and the "help-line" from brother was no help at all. I simply gave up, and just use the usb cable. I guess I am too used to the ease of using apple products with simple and common sense installations. Again--the printer works fine, but the set up for the wireless is so complicated that it is not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer a few months ago after doing lots of research. Also one of my close friends has one and he has been using it for about a year. This printer is very easy to set up, the wireless configuration took less than five minutes and it was painless. Print quality is excellent and impressive, plus its quiet too. What I love about this printer is it's price and features that you get with it, such as it being wireless, coming with a toner and drum, easy set up etc. I strongly recommend it to the people who have a photo printer and are looking for a reliable printer to do the B/W printing.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous value
customer_reviews.text: I am keeping this short since other 4 and 5 star reviewers have covered all the good points about this printer. I installed (through router) in a few minutes, no problems at all, and no problems since. It is a dandy printer with a small footprint, is quiet, print quality excellent. And the price makes it a fabulous value.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Pepper

product_meta.title: Brother HL-2170W 23ppm Laser Printer with Wireless and Wired Network Interfaces
product_meta.description:
The HL-2170W is a network, monochrome laser printer that is ideal for home or home office printer sharing. It features network connectivity via Ethernet and wireless interfaces, a fast print speed of up to 23ppm, HQ resolution (up to 2400 x 600 dpi) for high-quality output, and quick processing with 32MB memory. The HL-2170W provides flexible paper handling via an enclosed 250-sheet capacity tray and a manual by-pass slot for printing envelopes and letterhead. It also offers a Toner Save mode to extend toner life and wide compatibility with support for Windows and Mac and PCL6 emulation.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description Ideal for both home and office use, the affordable Brother HL-2170W Laser Printer features network connectivity via wireless/wired interfaces, and prints up to 23 pages per minute at a high-quality resolution, giving your work and personal documents a polished finish colleagues and friends are sure to envy.

 

Versatile and Professional
This monochrome laser printer not only warms up in less than 10 seconds and prints up to 23 pages per minute to give you near-instant access to important reports, documents, and annual family letters when you need them, it also includes a manual bypass feeder for professional printing on envelopes and letterhead. The high-quality resolution (up to 2400 x 600 dpi) of this personal black-and-white laser printer reflects the time and care that you put into each document, while giving you the benefits of low cost per page laser output. The printer also includes 32 MB memory, and a 250-sheet capacity tray that can conveniently accommodate standard, legal, and custom-sized paper. Built-In Wired and Wireless Networking 
Perfect for family or home offices, the HL-2170W gives you the option to connect the printer via USB, Ethernet, or 802.11b/g wireless networking. Brother makes wireless setup a snap; for users with wireless access points that support SecureEasySetup, Wi-Fi Protected Setup, or AOSS, you can automatically configure your wireless settings by simply pressing a button on your router. 

 Ergonomic and Energy Efficient
The Brother HL-2140 17.9-by-18.7-by-14.2-inch efficient design features a toner save mode for extended toner life as well as sleep mode. Easy to set up and a breeze to use, this printer is compatible with both Mac and Windows operating systems, and includes an animated user-friendly tutorial to help answer common support and maintenance questions. 

 
For added peace of mind, this machine is Energy Star compliant, which means it helps save the environment while saving you money. (Energy Star is a joint program of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the U.S. Department of Energy promoting energy efficiency).

 This personal laser printer is backed by a one-year limited manufacturer's warranty.

 What's in the Box
HL-2170W laser printer, starter toner cartridge and instruction kit.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The HL-2170W is a network, monochrome laser printer that is ideal for home or home office printer sharing. It features network connectivity via Ethernet and wireless interfaces, a fast print speed of up to 23ppm, HQ resolution (up to 2400 x 600 dpi) for high-quality output, and quick processing with 32MB memory. The HL-2170W provides flexible paper handling via an enclosed 250-sheet capacity tray and a manual by-pass slot for printing envelopes and letterhead. It also offers a Toner Save mode to extend toner life and wide compatibility with support for Windows and Mac and PCL6 emulation.

See more
feature_bullets: Monochrome laser printer prints up to 23 ppm, perfect for home or office use
Features network connectivity via wireless/wired interfaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars795 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
